core_components.description: Building the muscular endurance and lip vibration control necessary for tone production.
Diaphragmatic control and steady air column delivery.
Valve fingerings, synchronization between hands and tongue.

milestones.goal: Consistent clear tone on G4 (Middle G) for 8 beats at 60 BPM.
Clean transitions between C4 and G4 without 'scooping' the pitch.

objective: Maximum duration of a held steady tone (seconds)
BPM accuracy of C Major scale eighth notes
subjective: Self-rated 'Ease of Play' on a scale of 1-10

practice_loop.step_1_input: Long tones focusing on air support and lip tension.
practice_loop.step_2_process: Lip slurs or simple scale patterns to test range and fingering.
practice_loop.step_3_output: Playing a simple 4-8 bar melody from a beginner method book.
practice_loop.step_4_review: Record the final 2 minutes; listen for one specific area of tension to release tomorrow.

difficulty_balancing.maintenance_threshold: 70% of session spent on notes/patterns I can already execute.
difficulty_balancing.growth_threshold: 30% of session spent on the 'edge' of my range or rhythm reading ability.

inferred_data.target_proficiency: I am assuming the target is a foundational intermediate level where the user can play standard scales and simple melodies accurately.
inferred_data.time_commitment: I interpreted '30' as 30 minutes per day, totaling 3.5 hours per week, which is optimal for beginner embouchure development to avoid fatigue.

timeline.summary: Initial practice strategy created for ['Learn Trumpet Playing'].
